sources.title: South of the Rio Grande (1945) THE CISCO KIDüçï DUNCAN RENALDO
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Duncan Renaldo, Martin Garralaga, Armida
Director: Lambert Hillyer

Cisco Kid and Pancho set off to track down a corrupt district officer who has murdered their dear friends and is threatening to kill others.

TRIVIA: The Cisco Kid is a fictional character created by O. Henry for his short story "The Caballero's Way," first published in 1907. Four actors portrayed this Western hero in 25 films during the sound era. In 1928, the first all-talking western starred Warner Baxter as the Cisco Kid, followed by Cesar Romero, Duncan Renaldo, and Gilbert Roland.

metadata.Plot: Miguel Sanches, the operator of a large rancho, has stolen cattle and then had innocent suspects shot. Cisco has been called on for help and arriving finds a wagon under attack. His men drive off the attackers and he finds the victim was to be Sanches' replacement. After changing clothes with the man, Cisco arrives posing as him in a attempt to get evidience against Sanchez.
metadata.Writer: Ralph Gilbert Bettison, Victor Hammond, O. Henry
